intro: Vaccinium imrayi, commonly known as the Imray huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark red or black in color. These berries are adapted to grow in acidic, nutrient-poor soils, a common trait among members of its family. Vaccinium imrayi is often found in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
